definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Time is the most fair and reasonable-it never gives more to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 时间是最公平合理的，它从不多给谁一分钟。

sentences.english: The stock transaction which the banker was spelling out was fair.
sentences.chinese: 这个银行家详加说明的股权处理，还是公平合理的。

sentences.english: A: Now Mr. Brown, what we have given is a fair price.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生，我们出的价格是公平合理的。

sentences.english: Microsoft says it offered a full and fair price.
sentences.chinese: 微软说他们报出了一个公平合理的价格。

sentences.english: Procedures concerning the enforcement of intellectual property rights shall be fair and equitable.
sentences.chinese: 知识产权的执法程序应公平合理。

sentences.english: If virtuous, it need not fear the fair operation of attack and defense.
sentences.chinese: 政府毋需害怕公平合理的攻击和辩护。

sentences.english: Expenses for the technology transfer shall be fair and reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 技术的转让费应该公平合理。

sentences.english: I'm not threatening, just giving you fair warning.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经光明磊落地对待你，给你公平合理的警告。

sentences.english: The injustices they did me rankled me for a long while.
sentences.chinese: 对我他们干了一些不公平合理的事，使我生了半天气。

sentences.english: I have dealt fairly with you, and have given you fair warning.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经光明磊落地对待你，给你公平合理的警告。

sentences.english: That seems reasonably fair, I think.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这是公平合理的。

definition: to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
